subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] One more quake voice
author: susan mousseau
full_text:
--0-1061846754-1153683444=:31581
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

amy, you dont have to meditate to have an OBE...most people have these at night and are unaware they are travelling astrally..during sleep, it is natural process to have an OBE, but while awake, just happened to me spontaneously...I visited a sick friend twice in the hospital astrally during the day, i cant explain how or why, but if you allow yourself , before you go to bed at night, ask that you have an astral experience..and that you remember it the next day...sue

Amy Swanson <lon3_s7ar@...> wrote:            all of this is in regards to astral travel? meditation achieves this? 
  is there techniques to acomplish this? What can you do/where can you go while traveling? 
   
  amy

susan mousseau <chokmasdaughter@...> wrote:
      hi Frank and Andrea, i have travelled astrally since i was young usually at night. a few years ago, it happened while i was awake, several times. one time, i connected with another spirit who was watching over the same person i was watching over..hmmm..not afraid at all of OBE'''s just better to be sitting down!!!LOL sue

Andrea Carr <ACARR3@...> wrote:           Hi Frank,
  
  LOL doesn�t that really stink. Hate that about sharing a bed with someone oh well short of smothering them-JK! I have the same fear of astral travel while I am awake. I have talked with people who can do that. I think it would just be a little freaky for me. If it happens while I am sleeping I have no fear of that.
  
  Andrea
  
  -----Original Message-----
From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Sumption Frank
Sent: Thursday, July 20, 2006 5:28 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] One more quake voice
  
           Yeah, that�s what I meant, coughing, gagging and snoring, I have to wear ear plugs! I used to be able to go to the other room, but then the grand kids moved in, and no more spare room. I have been in that paralyzed state a few times, but only one conscious projection. I can get close though, even to the point of seeing through my eyelids! I think I still have a fear block of actually leaving the body. 
  
  
   Frank
  
      
---------------------------------
  
  From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Andrea Carr
Sent: Thursday, July 20, 2006 3:29 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] One more quake voice

  
          Really I haven�t ever woken up while leaving but when coming back and woke up in almost a half awake state feeling trapped because I couldn�t move until I shook it off.
  
  Well it depends on what you mean about your wife not being gone long enough-LOL my hubby can snore really badly and I have had to go in another room to sleep. I should have him get that checked though.
  
  
  Andrea
  
  -----Original Message-----
From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Sumption Frank
Sent: Thursday, July 20, 2006 2:31 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] One more quake voice
  
           I read that in one of my Astral books, but have never tried it. Everytime I get close, the process of leaving breaks my awareness, and I�m instantly awake. I had started to work on astral projection again when the wife was in the hospital, but she wasn�t in long enough (cold!?). 
  
  
  
  
      
---------------------------------
  
  From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Andrea Carr
Sent: Thursday, July 20, 2006 1:00 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] One more quake voice

  
          I had read something about that recently too. If I did astral travel last night I don�t remember it & I did only stay asleep for about � an hour at a time. But also when I do astral travel it also leaves me more tired than when I went to bed.
  
  Thanks!
  Andrea
  
  -----Original Message-----
From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Sumption Frank
Sent: Thursday, July 20, 2006 1:27 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] One more quake voice
  
          I thought that was supposed to be good for Astral work, the unsettled weather?
  
      
---------------------------------
  
  From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Andrea Carr
Sent: Thursday, July 20, 2006 11:35 AM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] One more quake voice

  
          I hear it now must have not had enough coffee in me. Didn�t sleep last night 5 hours worth of off and on t-storms ugh!
  
  Andrea
  
  -----Original Message-----
From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Sumption Frank
Sent: Thursday, July 20, 2006 12:25 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] One more quake voice
  
          The word quake is made out of noise.
